"New Dark Age: Technology and the End of the Future" is a book written by James Bridle. The book explores the idea that we are living in a "New Dark Age" where our understanding and relationship with technology has become so complex that we are no longer able to understand or predict its consequences.

The book starts by describing how our understanding of technology has changed over time, and how we've come to rely on it in ways that we don't fully understand. It then delves into the ways in which technology is shaping our society and culture, including the impact on politics, economics, and personal relationships.

Bridle argues that we are facing a crisis of understanding, where our relationship with technology has become so complex that we are unable to predict or control its consequences. He also discusses the ways in which this lack of understanding is contributing to the erosion of democracy and the rise of authoritarianism.

The book also covers the impact of technology on our environment and natural resources, and how it is contributing to climate change and other environmental crises. It also explores the role of artificial intelligence and the impact it will have on our society in the future.

In summary, "New Dark Age" is a book that explores the idea that we are living in a "New Dark Age" where our understanding and relationship with technology has become so complex that we are no longer able to understand or predict its consequences. The book also covers the impact of technology on our society, culture, politics, economy, environment and personal relationships and the potential consequences of our increasing reliance on technology.
